name: Origins of Speculative Freemasonry
description: The transition from early speculative freemasonry (non-operative masonry) in the 1640s to the organized Grand Lodge system established in 1717-1723. This network traces key figures who documented early speculative initiations and those who organized the Premier Grand Lodge of England, culminating in the 1723 Constitutions that standardized freemasonry.
author: HistoryNet Contributors

scope.exclusionNotes: Focusing on speculative (non-operative) freemasonry, not operative masonry traditions. Emphasis on England/Scotland transition period (1640s-1723), not later continental developments.
